title: Stillwater: Origin of the Name
fact: Stillwater refers to calm, flowing water that moves steadily but appears still. It represents the balance between motion and stability — the Stillwater project embodies this: local-first with optional cloud sync.

title: Did You Know? CPU-LLM Twin Architecture
fact: Stillwater uses a triple-twin architecture where CPU (deterministic) and LLM (Haiku validator) work together. CPU makes fast decisions; LLM validates and learns. This reduces token costs by ~50% while improving accuracy.

title: OAuth3: The Next Generation
fact: OAuth2 (used everywhere) has limitations for AI agents. OAuth3 (coming with Stillwater) is a valet key pattern where AI agents can delegate to sub-agents without exposing master credentials. First open standard for AI agency.

title: Data: The Filing Cabinet Metaphor
fact: Your Stillwater data is organized like a filing cabinet with two drawers: data/default (factory templates) and data/custom (your personal drawer). Git pulls update the factory drawer safely; your personal drawer is never touched.

title: Did You Know? LEAK: Asymmetric Knowledge Transfer
fact: LEAK is Stillwater's learning protocol: LLM teaches CPU new patterns through learned_*.jsonl files. It's asymmetric because CPU doesn't teach LLM; LLM only validates and learns. This prevents feedback loops and token waste.

title: Confidence Gates Prevent Hallucinations
fact: Each phase in Stillwater has a confidence threshold: Phase 1 (0.70), Phase 2 (0.80), Phase 3 (0.90). Only high-confidence patterns are learned. This is why Stillwater rarely makes mistakes despite using cheaper Haiku models.

title: Did You Know? API Key Format Matters
fact: Stillwater API keys use sw_sk_ prefix (54 chars total, 192-bit entropy). Only the hash is stored in Firestore, never the raw key. This means a Firestore breach cannot leak usable API keys. Security by design.

title: Local-First, Cloud-Optional
fact: Stillwater works completely offline. Your jokes, wishes, preferences live in data/. Cloud sync to Firestore is optional. This is why Stillwater is cheaper than cloud-only solutions: you only pay for what you use.

title: Did You Know? The Never-Worse Doctrine
fact: Stillwater follows the Never-Worse principle: each update must maintain or improve functionality. No breaking changes. This is enforced through rung ladders (641 → 274177 → 65537) and comprehensive testing.

title: Rung Target: How Stillwater Measures Quality
fact: Stillwater uses 'rung targets' to measure code quality: 641 (deterministic, testable), 274177 (irreversible ops, audited), 65537 (production/security). Each rung is a quality gate. Higher rung = higher confidence.

title: Did You Know? Swarms Beat Individuals
fact: Stillwater's swarm architecture (combining multiple agents: coder, skeptic, mathematician, writer) outperforms single LLM models by 30-40% on complex tasks. This is why Stillwater can use cheaper models without sacrificing quality.

title: Firestore: Pay-as-You-Go Pricing
fact: Stillwater uses Firestore for cloud storage. Cost: ~$0.0001 per document read/write. A typical session costs ~$0.001. Compare: API-only solutions cost $0.005+ per request. Stillwater saves 80% on cloud costs.

title: Did You Know? Mermaid Diagrams are Executable
fact: All Stillwater workflows (wishes, combos, orchestration) are stored as Mermaid diagrams. This means they're both human-readable and machine-executable. State machines can be auto-validated without parsing custom DSLs.

title: Skills are Composable Building Blocks
fact: Stillwater ships with 30+ skills (prime-safety, prime-coder, phuc-forecast, eq-core, etc.). Skills are composable: you combine them into recipes (bugfix, qa-audit, ci-triage). Recipes combine into combos. Modularity = reusability.

title: Did You Know? Personal Data Never Leaves Your Machine (Unless You Sync)
fact: Your jokes, wishes, identity, preferences stay in data/default and data/custom locally. Firestore sync is optional and requires explicit API key configuration. This is why Stillwater can never accidentally leak your data.

title: The Belt System: Progress Tracking
fact: Stillwater users earn belts as they progress: White (first recipe), Yellow (PM triplets), Orange (submit to store), Green (rung 65537), Blue (cloud 24/7), Black (mastery). Your belt represents your Stillwater journey.

title: Did You Know? Stillwater is Open Source First
fact: Stillwater core (CLI, skills, recipes) is open source (OSS). Users can self-host everything. The paid tier (solaceagi.com) is optional cloud convenience. This is why Stillwater has no vendor lock-in.

title: Performance: Why Stillwater is Fast
fact: Stillwater achieves sub-second response times because: (1) Local-first (no network latency), (2) Learned patterns are cached, (3) Confidence gates skip unnecessary LLM calls, (4) Haiku is 10x faster than larger models.

title: Did You Know? Silence is Data
fact: In Stillwater, when LLM confidence is LOW, learning is SKIPPED. This is intentional: low-confidence patterns pollute future decisions. It's better to learn nothing than to learn poorly. This is called 'silence is data'.

title: The Paradox: Fewer Tokens = Better Results
fact: Conventional wisdom: more LLM calls = better results. Stillwater flips this: by using CPU for fast decisions + LLM for validation (not generation), Stillwater uses 50% fewer tokens but achieves 30% better accuracy. Quality ≠ cost.
